revised_title: Stored Energy in Work-Hardened Materials: A Theoretical Calculation
tldr: The author calculates the stored energy in a work-hardened material, assuming that the energy is due to piled-up groups of dislocations. The model predicts that a small percentage of the work done in deformation is stored, and the amount of energy stored is proportional to the strain. The predictions are in reasonable agreement with experimental results, particularly for large strains.
